greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, after which, for odd n: a(n) = A260439(n)-th number k for which A260438(k) = A260438(n)-1, and for even n: a(n) = a(n/2).
comment: For odd numbers n > 1, a(n) tells which term is on the immediately preceding row of A255551 (square array generated by Lucky sieve), in the same column where n itself is.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..11017
formula: a(1) = 1; after which for even n, a(n) = a(n/2), and for odd n, a(n) = A255551(A260438(n)-1, A260439(n)).
program: (Scheme) (define (A269370 n) (cond ((= 1 n) n) ((even? n) (A269370 (/ n 2))) (else (A255551bi (- (A260438 n) 1) (A260439 n))))) ;; Code for A255551bi given in A255551.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 01 2016
